question.title: How is it possible for a kafka listener to be part of multiple kafka containers?
question.body:
this spring kafka docs says:

Obtaining the Consumer group.id

When running the same listener code in multiple containers, it may be useful to be able to determine which container (identified by its group.id consumer property) that a record came from.

Given a java piece of executing kafka listener code, I am assuming the listener can be part of only one factory either default or the one specified in the @KafkaListner annotation.

But given the earlier quoted statement from kafka docs, seems there is more to it. How can I make a listener to be part of multiple containers?
